newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Gujral lodges motion of confidence.
newsitem.headline: India's Gujral lodges motion of confidence.

text.p: India's new Prime Minister Inder Kumar Gujral on Tuesday lodged a motion of confidence in his centre-left government in the lower house of parliament.

Gujral, India's fourth prime minister in less than a year, was expected to win the vote by a wide margin as the Congress party has pledged to support his one-day-old government. The vote was expected by 6 p.m. (1230 GMT), house speaker P.A. Sangma said.
"I move that this House expresses its confidence in the council of ministers," Gujral said.
Gujral took power on Monday after three weeks of political crisis, and assured industry and investors that it would be "business as usual" under his regime.

His predecessor, H.D. Deve Gowda, fell on April 11 when he lost a vote of confidence by a lopsided margin. The vote was triggered by Congress's decision to revoke support for Deve Gowda's government. Congress accused Deve Gowda of trying to sideline India's oldest party.

Gujral's 15-party United Front coalition has 178 legislators in the 542-member lower house, the Lok Sabha. Congress has 140, and the biggest single party, the rightwing Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), controls 193 votes.
